body_html:
Yes, the error message doesn't make sense. I followed instructions in https://www.tensorflow.org/how_tos/adding_an_op/ which says to put BUILD file in core/user_ops. It passes analysis if I don't add dependency to //tensorflow/core:core_cpu or //tensorflow/core:core, but then bazel complains about missing device.h

cc @keveman in case he knows how to properly have user ops depend on device.h (part of //tensorflow/core:core_cpu target)
body_text:
Yes, the error message doesn't make sense. I followed instructions in https://www.tensorflow.org/how_tos/adding_an_op/ which says to put BUILD file in core/user_ops. It passes analysis if I don't add dependency to //tensorflow/core:core_cpu or //tensorflow/core:core, but then bazel complains about missing device.h
cc @keveman in case he knows how to properly have user ops depend on device.h (part of //tensorflow/core:core_cpu target)
body:
Yes, the error message doesn't make sense. I followed instructions in https://www.tensorflow.org/how_tos/adding_an_op/ which says to put `BUILD` file in `core/user_ops`. It passes analysis if I don't add dependency to `//tensorflow/core:core_cpu` or `//tensorflow/core:core`, but then bazel complains about missing `device.h`

cc @keveman in case he knows how to properly have user ops depend on `device.h` (part of `//tensorflow/core:core_cpu` target)
